title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito has yet to sign with a new team after opting out of his Red Sox contract in 2025.
Despite a strong 2025 season, Giolito remains a free agent, surprising Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet.
Red Sox added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, making them an unlikely destination for Giolito's return.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Michael Pittman Jr.'s high salary could make him a trade target for the Patriots, needing a receiver to replace Stefon Diggs.
The Patriots could consider acquiring DJ Moore, contingent on contract adjustments, to bolster their wide receiver options.
Edge rusher Uchenna Nwosu from the Seahawks presents a viable target, with a manageable cap hit, for bolstering the Patriots' defense.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage at Celtics practice but has no set return date.
Tatum has missed the entire season due to an Achilles tear and is progressing through his rehabilitation.
The Celtics have not announced if Tatum will return this season, focusing on his full recovery first.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports broadcasters Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a notable call during Team USA's overtime win in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir allowed Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating performance to unfold with minimal commentary.
Broadcasters demonstrated restraint during crucial Milan Cortina Olympic moments, enhancing viewer experience by avoiding overtalking.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June, using remaining federal funds.
Mayor Michelle Wu initiated the free bus program in 2022 with $8 million in federal COVID-19 relief funds.
City and MBTA officials are in talks about the long-term future of the free fare initiative post-June.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow totals with 6.5 inches in Leyden on February 21.
Essex County saw significant snowfall, with Haverhill recording up to 5 inches and Methuen 4.6 inches.
A 'high impact' snowstorm with potential blizzard conditions is expected to hit Massachusetts Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa has been inspired by her coworker, Annie, who has completed the marathon 24 times and acted as her coach.
LaRosa's participation highlights personal growth, as she fulfills a dream she once deemed impossible, thanks to encouragement and support.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, of Pembroke, NH, sentenced to 15 months for misusing over $1 million in COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 in Economic Injury Disaster Loans to buy Angus Lea Golf Course, violating CARES Act terms.
Kirouac pled guilty to wire fraud for misappropriating COVID funds intended for business pandemic hardships.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with larceny and drug possession in Boston, has theft history dating back to 2001.
Cutelis allegedly stole merchandise from high-end Back Bay stores, including Lululemon and Ralph Lauren, totaling over $9,500.
Bail set at $2,500; held on fugitive charge from New Hampshire; next court date is March 6.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony as their leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora announced.
Anthony excelled in the leadoff role at the end of 2025, achieving a .336 average with six home runs in that spot.
Manager Cora also confirmed Willson Contreras as the cleanup hitter, hinting at potential lineup spots for others like Trevor Story.
